messages.content:
You are a debugging assistant. You will be presented with a failing test, and tools (functions) to access the source code of the system under test (SUT). Your task is to provide a step-by-step explanation of how the bug occurred, based on the failing test and the information you retrieved using tests about the SUT. You will be given 9 chances to interact with functions to gather relevant information. An example answer would look like follows.

Title: Diagnosis of test `testGenerateURLFragment`
Details: The test `testGenerateURLFragment` checks whether HTML entities such as `"` are correctly escaped to their corresponding character by the `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` method. However, the test failure indicates that this is not the case. Following the execution path, we find that `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` is not escaping any HTML code; instead, it is using its input `toolTipText` as is. Consequently, un-escaped strings are being returned, which leads to the error demonstrated by the test.

After providing this diagnosis, you will be prompted to suggest which methods would be the best locations to be fixed. The answers should be in the form of `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` without commentary (one per line), as your answer will be automatically processed before finally being presented to the user.

The failing test `com.google.javascript.jscomp.CodePrinterTest.testMinusNegativeZero()` is part of the `CodePrinter` class in the `com.google.javascript.jscomp` package. Some other classes in the same package include `NodeTraversal`, `PassFactory`, `CompilerInput`, and others.

Next, I will check the methods covered by failing tests in the `CodePrinter` class. I will do this by calling the `get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class` function for the `CodePrinter` class.

messages.name: get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class
messages.content: [".CompactCodePrinter.maybeCutLine()", ".CompactCodePrinter.notePreferredLineBreak()", ".CompactCodePrinter.append(java.lang.String)", ".MappedCodePrinter.getLastChar()", ".Builder.setLineLengthThreshold(int)", ".CompactCodePrinter.CompactCodePrinter(boolean, boolean, int, boolean, com.google.javascript.jscomp.SourceMap.DetailLevel)", ".CompactCodePrinter.endFile()", ".Builder.setPrettyPrint(boolean)", ".MappedCodePrinter.MappedCodePrinter(int, boolean, com.google.javascript.jscomp.SourceMap.DetailLevel)", ".MappedCodePrinter.startSourceMapping(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".MappedCodePrinter.endSourceMapping(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".MappedCodePrinter.getCode()", ".Builder.Builder(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".Builder.build()", ".toSource(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.jscomp.CodePrinter.Format, boolean, boolean, int, com.google.javascript.jscomp.SourceMap, com.google.javascript.jscomp.SourceMap.DetailLevel, java.nio.charset.Charset, boolean)"]

The `CodePrinter` class has several methods covered by failing tests. Some of the methods include:
- `CompactCodePrinter.maybeCutLine()`
- `CompactCodePrinter.notePreferredLineBreak()`
- `CompactCodePrinter.append(String)`
- `MappedCodePrinter.getLastChar()`
- `Builder.setLineLengthThreshold(int)`
- `CompactCodePrinter.CompactCodePrinter(boolean, boolean, int, boolean, SourceMap.DetailLevel)`
- `CompactCodePrinter.endFile()`
- `Builder.setPrettyPrint(boolean)`
- `MappedCodePrinter.MappedCodePrinter(int, boolean, SourceMap.DetailLevel)`
- And more.

Based on the failing test `CodePrinterTest.testMinusNegativeZero()` which is related to printing JavaScript code, we need to investigate the method `toSource` in the `CodePrinter` class as it is closely related to code printing. Let me fetch the code snippet for the `toSource` method to further analyze the issue.

function_call.name: get_code_snippet
function_call.arguments: {"signature":"com.google.javascript.jscomp.CodePrinter.toSource(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.jscomp.CodePrinter.Format, boolean, boolean, int, com.google.javascript.jscomp.SourceMap, com.google.javascript.jscomp.SourceMap.DetailLevel, java.nio.charset.Charset, boolean)"}

messages.name: get_code_snippet

messages.content:
The `toSource` method in the `CodePrinter` class is responsible for generating the source code for a given JavaScript node. It uses a `CodeGenerator` based on the `outputFormat` provided and eventually returns the generated code. 

The issue in the failing test `testMinusNegativeZero` seems to be related to the expected output containing extra spaces around the negative symbol `-`. This could be due to how the negative zero is handled in the generated code. The incorrect positioning of spaces might be causing the assertion to fail.

To address this issue, the logic in the `CompactCodePrinter` or `PrettyCodePrinter` (depending on the `outputFormat`) where the negative numbers are printed should be reviewed. The extra spaces around the negative symbol `-` should be adjusted to match the expected output.

Next, I will suggest the methods in the `CodePrinter` class that could be the best locations to fix this issue. Let me retrieve the failing tests covered by those methods for better insight.

messages.name: get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class
messages.content: [".CompactCodePrinter.maybeCutLine()", ".CompactCodePrinter.notePreferredLineBreak()", ".CompactCodePrinter.append(java.lang.String)", ".MappedCodePrinter.getLastChar()", ".Builder.setLineLengthThreshold(int)", ".CompactCodePrinter.CompactCodePrinter(boolean, boolean, int, boolean, com.google.javascript.jscomp.SourceMap.DetailLevel)", ".CompactCodePrinter.endFile()", ".Builder.setPrettyPrint(boolean)", ".MappedCodePrinter.MappedCodePrinter(int, boolean, com.google.javascript.jscomp.SourceMap.DetailLevel)", ".MappedCodePrinter.startSourceMapping(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".MappedCodePrinter.endSourceMapping(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".MappedCodePrinter.getCode()", ".Builder.Builder(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".Builder.build()", ".toSource(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.jscomp.CodePrinter.Format, boolean, boolean, int, com.google.javascript.jscomp.SourceMap, com.google.javascript.jscomp.SourceMap.DetailLevel, java.nio.charset.Charset, boolean)"]

The methods in the `CodePrinter` class that could potentially be the best locations to fix the issue with extra spaces around the negative symbol `-` in the generated code are:
- `CompactCodePrinter.maybeCutLine()`
- `CompactCodePrinter.notePreferredLineBreak()`
- `CompactCodePrinter.append(String)`
- `MappedCodePrinter.getLastChar()`
- `CompactCodePrinter.CompactCodePrinter(boolean, boolean, int, boolean, SourceMap.DetailLevel)`
- `CompactCodePrinter.endFile()`
- `Builder.setPrettyPrint(boolean)`
- And others.

These methods are closely related to the formatting and printing of JavaScript code, which could impact the presence of extra spaces in the output. Further investigation within these methods may help identify and rectify the issue.

If you need more details on any specific method or code snippet, feel free to ask!

Based on the available information, provide the signatures of the most likely culprit methods for the bug. Your answer will be processed automatically, so make sure to only answer with the accurate signatures of all likely culprits (in `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` format), without commentary (one per line).
